name: InfracostComment
description: Posts a comment to a pull request showing cloud cost estimates for Terraform. Requires setup task to have been run.
author: Infracost

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the JSON file generated from a `infracost breakdown` using the `--format=json` and `--out` flags. For multiple paths, pass a glob pattern (e.g. "infracost_*.json", glob needs quotes) or a JSON array of paths.

inputs.name: githubToken
inputs.label: Github Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: GitHub access token. **Required if repository provider is GitHub.**

inputs.name: azureReposToken
inputs.label: Azure Repos Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Repos system access token. **Required if repository provider is Azure Repos.**

inputs.name: behavior
inputs.label: Behavior
inputs.helpMarkDown: The behavior to use when posting cost estimate comments. Must be one of 'update' | 'delete-and-new' | 'hide-and-new' | 'new'.

inputs.name: targetType
inputs.label: Target Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Which objects should be commented on, either `pull-request` or `commit`. The `commit` option is available only for GitHub repositories.

inputs.name: tag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Customize the comment tag. This is added to the comment as a markdown comment (hidden) to detect the previously posted comments. This is useful if you have multiple workflows that post comments to the same pull request or commit.

inputs.name: dryRun
inputs.label: Dry Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skips any comment posting, deleting or hiding. The comment output is still saved to the $(Build.SourcesDirectory)/infracost-comment.md.
